Name: Poor Choices: Black Mamba Expansion
Description: The Second Expansion Pack includes 112 brand new cards that work well when combined with the Adult Edition.

Name: Ninjitsu: Sabotage
Description:
15 card expansion featuring unique abilities and effects

Players scheme to be the first to reach 21 points. Each turn either play a card or draw 2 cards; cards can either be played as a treasure or as an action. Hidden treasures are treasure cards that are played face-down. Swipe hidden treasures from your opponents at any time, but watch out for booby-traps!

This is an expansion and Ninjitsu is required to play.

Name: Ninjitsu: Promo Pack
Description:
13 New cards for Ninjitsu
Released alongside Kickstarter base game

Name: Ob Robert etwa Kleingeld hat?
Description:
Each game board is used by 2 players, who move in opposite directions. The first player to reach the opposite circular space wins the game (space 121 or 0) an gets the content of the cash box.

Movement is determined by 4 dice with the numbers 1 to 4 and "+" and "-" on their sides. Each number on a die is for another player color. "+" and "-" for each color are on the same die as the "1". The Players may only move the amount of spaces indicated by the numbers of their own color. If a player rolls al 4 of his numbers the roll counts double. If all dice show the same number, the Player may move for all 4 dice.

On the roll of a "+" of his color, the player gets 1 token from the cash box, on a "-" he has to pay 1 token. If all 4 dice show a "+" he gets 4 token and on 4 "-" he has to pay 4 token.

If a player rolls only the color of an other player, this player may move 2 spaces and gets 1 token for a "+" from the active player. If a "-" is rolled the other player has to pay 1 token to the active player.

If a player gets on a space of his own color he gets to move 1 space ahead. On a black space with a white dot the player has to skip a turn. The spaces with the thick black border cause the players to jump 2 spaces back. If a player would get on an occupied space he may not move and has to wait for his next turn.

—user summary

Name: Slaughterball: Maverick Set KS1
Description:
Available from The Dice Tower Season 13 Indeigogo campaign. (Promo Pack G)
Includes 6 Maverick Cards and 6 large athlete miniatures

Name: East Indiaman: Solo and 5 player
Description:
1. Solo expansion:

For solo game, you will play against the dummy player John.
Whenever John performs an action, he is not required to spend or use any resource. In addition, he also ignores the effects of empty spots on the pirate alert track.

John's action will be determined by the action marker, the dummy player action tile and the result of the die roll.
For a more challenging game, you can play against John on B side of the dummy player action tiles; the more rounds you play against John on B side of the action tiles, the harder the game will become.

2. 5 player expansion:

In a 5 player game, after the first player has been determined during the game preparations, the 5th player in player order will place two additional tokens in his/her reserve area.

When scoring for arms level at game and, in a 5 player game, each player will receive 2 points for each other player that falls behind on the arms level track.

—description from the publiser

Name: Oni (Second Edition)
Description:
In Old Japan spring it’s a big celebration, and while everybody wonders looking the flowers bloom, the Oni, twisted and legendary creatures fight each other to see who is the one who makes more mischief endevors before somebody catches them... who will be the winner?

This new edition introduces several gameplay improvements, making it faster to play and easier to memory but the same big fun for all players.

Name: Dragonfire: Assassin Kobold Promo Card
Description:
2018 GAMA convention promo character screen.  This screen has the same art as the Rogue Kobold found in the character pack expansion "Heroes of the Wild", however this character is classed as an Assassin and comes with a pre-printed feature found only on this promo. Also, it is important to note the "Pack Hunters" ability is different from the Rogue Kobold:

Assassin Kobold promo "Pack Hunters" reads: "Once per scene when another character attacks an encounter facing you, you may play any one card as an Assist against that encounter" 
Rogue Kobold "Pack Hunters" reads: "Once per scene when another character attacks an encounter facing you, you may play any number of Basic cards as Assists against that encounter"

This character screen is also sized slightly different than all other screens to date.

Name: Expedition: The Future
Description:
The Future expands the Expedition universe into space with a new Tech ability class, Synth enemies, and Skills for your adventurer to master both in and out of combat.

—description from the publisher

Name: Whistle Stop: Extra Reserve Promo Tile
Description:
Whistle Stop: Extra Reserve Promo Tile

How to Get:  Visit the Bezier Games Booth at origins 2018
Quantity Available:  200 for the entire convention

Gain resources when you gain a stock

Name: Unrivaled
Description:
Be best at being the worst. Be worst at being the best. Be Unrivaled.
Welcome to a brand new party game experience where players guess the winner before each challenge begins! Draw a card and ask the question out loud.
Who is the best artist? Who would make the best spy? Who was a problem child?
Which group would make the worst sales team?
Predict the winner and then read the back of the card, where players are challenged to a variety of madcap contests of story-telling, trivia, dexterity and role-playing to determine who is the best, who is the worst and who is, ultimately, the Unrivaled.

Name: Dark Masts
Description:
Dark Masts is a 2 player deck building card game of high fantasy, in which players take control of powerful captains and mighty war ships in order to rule the seas. The game uses a unique three deck system where players compete for the scarce resources they will need to build their ship and destroy their foes.

In this 1 v. 1 game each player chooses a nation and places the captain and ship in play. Drawing up to 5 cards from any combination of common deck or the nation specific deck players will draw cards to upgrade their ship. Available upgrades are stronger cannons, thicker and stronger hulls, and crew members with special abilities. Players declare an action during the action phase that can include boarding the enemy ships, attacking with the ships crew and cannons, or batton down the hatches to give a temporary defense boost. Shaman and mages can be used to cast spells giving boosts to your crew, damaging enemy ships, or repairing your own ship.

Name: Darker Deeds
Description:
Darker Deeds is an expansion to Dark Deeds. For Darker Deeds, Games & Gears selected cards from their previously available, limited edition booster packs created for AdeptiCon and Gen Con, leaving a handful and any associated mechanics as exclusives to those limited edition sets, while adding 16 entirely new cards to the mix.

Rounding off the deck are three new, perilous-to-pick-up Dark Deed cards, bringing the total card count to 30. Also included is a bone-colored, custom d12, useful when playing the `Sniped!` Plot card and simultaneously rolling to beat a rival minion`s attack, as well as a metal `Most Suspicious Minion` coin which is passed around players as they gain or lose suspicion to spice things up.

Name: Zombie Sheep: Dung of the Dead
Description:
This is a promo card for the game Zombie Sheep, given out at conventions and to playtesters.

Dung of the Dead is shuffled in to the game deck. It is played against an opponent, causing that opponent to lose their turn.

Name: Diggity Dogs
Description: A card collection game where players attempt to adopt the most dogs by gathering cards representing what each dog needs. The adoptable dogs are on cardboard stand-ups; each has icons denoting its three wants (a bone, a bowl, a stick, etc.). Players take turn asking other players for cards in an attempt to match all three of a dog's wants to collect that dog. If the player has that item, they must give it to the asker; if not, the asker draws from the pile. The game ends when all dogs have been adopted and the player with the most dogs wins. 2014 Oppenheim Toy Portfolio Gold Seal.

Name: Patrol: A Coloring Card Game – Power Patrol
Description:
Power Patrol is the original deck for Patrol: A Coloring Card Game. The Power Patrol deck first premiered at the 2017 Great Philly Con. The deck featured the original artwork and abilities of the game. In development of the game, a few spelling errors were added to designate the first printing. However, there ended up being a lot more spelling errors than intended.

—description from the designer

Name: Hail Hydra: Hawkeye Promo Card
Description:
Originally available at GenCon 2018 as part of GameStop event

Hail Hydra - Hawkeye

Player Card

Weapon of Choice:
Take all attack cards used this offensive. Secretly place 2 of them into your hand. Secretly discard the rest

Name: Ant Swarm
Description:
In Ant Swarm, you take on the role of running an ant colony. You will need to acquire Food and Water Pods with your Worker Ants, capture your opponent’s Ants with your Fighter Ants, and, most importantly, protect your Queen Ant from being captured by your opponent’s army.

During the game, each player may move either their Worker Ant OR Fighter Ant tiles. Move the Worker Ants towards the center of the board to collect Water and Food Pods, then move them back to your Queen to redeem for Energy Pods. Your Fighter Ants will face your opponent on the field of battle. If you win, you get to lock up your opponent’s Ants in your dungeon and force your opponent to rescue their Ants. To win: capture your opponent’s Queen first.

—description from the publisher

Name: SHEEPLE: The Best Game in the Ewe-niverse
Description:
A hilarious party game where you start as a sheep, and are trying to evolve into sheep-person.


     Pick a category
     Frantically Brainstorm for one minute.
     Compare Answers – Items only score points if other players also put them down.


So to win, you must THINK LIKE A SHEEPLE!

—description from the publisher

Name: Ordleg
Description:
Ordleg is a domino-like card game where you get points by creating 4 letter words.

The game contains 48 word cards + 6 rules cards.

Name: Catalyst: Promo Goal Card E
Description:
This is the Promo Goal card marked as "E" for the game Catalyst. The game comes with 4 Goal cards marked A through D, and this is the fifth one in the series.

To use it, simply shuffle it together with the Goal cards from the basic game, and select one at random.

The Goal card E awards points in the following ways:

- Blue building: Score 1 VP for each Catalyst card in the color of which you have the most in your Scoring Pile.

- Green building: Score 1 VP for every three Catalyst cards in your Scoring Pile.

- Yellow building: Score 2 VP for each “5” Catalyst card you have in your Scoring Pile.

- Red building: Score 2 VP for each set of “1”+”2”+”3” Catalyst cards in your Scoring Pile (regardless of their color).

Name: Strontium Dog: The Good, the Bad, & the Mutie Starter Set
Description:
This fast-paced tabletop miniatures game allows two or more players to fight out scenes from the Strontium Dog universe defined by legendary comic creators John Wagner and Carlos Ezquerra. Players take control of a small team of bounty hunters or the outlaws, criminals and renegades they hunt in gun battles, chases and showdowns across the galaxy.

This starter set is based around the classic confrontation between mutant Search/Destroy agents (AKA Strontium Dogs) Johnny Alpha & Wulf Sternhammer and the infamous Max Bubba's gang - a pivotal storyline within the pages of the galaxy's greatest comic - 2000 AD.

Containing all the game rules, a scenario booklet to help you learn the game and refight the S/D Agents' showdown with their mutant foes, as well as superbly detailed miniatures to fight over the solar farm scenery, this is a great way to get started with your Strontium Dog games.

Includes:
112-page Full-colour A4 Softback Rulebook
12-page Scenario Booklet
8 Miniatures
  â€£ Skull
  â€£ Max Bubba
  â€£ Impetigo Jones
  â€£ Wulf Sternhammer
  â€£ The Gronk
  â€£ Johnny Alpha
  â€£ Low-Down O'Phee
  â€£ Brute Mosely
2 Tokens Sprue
36 Game Cards
6 Character Cards
Laser-cut MDF Solar Farm
2 Six-sided Dice
8 2000AD Combat Dice

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – RZ-2 A-Wing Expansion Pack
Description:
The main interceptor of the Resistance, the RZ-2 A-Wing is the natural evolution of its predecessor used by the Rebel Alliance. With several field-tested refinements integrated into its design, the new generation of A-wing fighters boasts incredible maneuverability to go along with blazingly fast speed, which makes mastering this craft a challenge worthy of the greatest aces.

The RZ-2 A-wing’s three defense dice and ability to evade incoming attacks make it a hard target to hit, and its redesigned swivel mounts deter pursuers by allowing pilots to target enemies behind them. One of the ship's many improvements over earlier models, these built-in Refined Gyrostabilizers provide the RZ-2 with a turret arc that can rotate exclusively between the front and back of the ship. This gives it some much needed flexibility in where it fires, but intrepid pilots must carefully choose where to direct their fire or miss out on opportunities elsewhere.
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Black Powder: A Clash of Eagles
Description:
A Clash Of Eagles is a glorious work of passion from the author Adrian McWalter. 200 pages of full-colour text, maps, and figures plus art from renowned artist Peter Dennis & Johnny Shumate. A must have for any collectors and gamers of the Napoleonic Black Powder period!

Re-create epic moments of the 1812 campaign: the battles of Smolensk and Borodino, the numerous smaller affairs involving Napoleon’s allies and the long, protracted retreat from Russia culminating in the crossing of the Berezina, all of which left the Grand Armée reduced to a shadow of its former self.

Within the pages you will discover how Napoleonic armies fought differently from preceding Black Powder armies; including background detail focusing on the campaign, the numerous nations that took part in the campaign, as well as their armies and statistics on over a hundred different troop types.

You will find information on how to reflect Napoleonic battles using the Black Powder rules as well as a few new rules that are pretty standard amongst wargames communities across the globe.

Running alongside this you will encounter numerous national characteristics for France, Russia, Austria and Prussia to name a few, that will give your gaming experience more of a Napoleonic feel.

—description from the publisher

Name: City Explorer: Tainan
Description:
City Explorer: Tainan contains 36 iconic location cards throughout the city. Plan a unique sight-seeing plan and compete against other players to create the best plan. Each turn, you first reveal two cards, then you may take two actions, possibly taking the same action twice. These actions are:


    Secretly look at a covered location card.
    Push and slide one column up or down.


Or you can pass and take a row of cards, which will be your finished travel plan used for scoring.

Should you take your time and search for the places you want to go? Or should you fix your plans and maybe mess with your rivals? Plan wisely and act swiftly since the perfect plan may be snatched by others!

Name: Pumpkin Patch: Gourd Attack!
Description:
Pumpkin Patch: Gourd Attack! is a mini-expansion for Pumpkin Patch: Bad Seeds.

Pumpkin Patch: Gourd Attack expands on the base game by adding the "recycle" mechanic. Recycle is a new keyword that allows you to remove a plot from your pumpkin patch and replace it with a gourd!

This mini-expansion contains 6 cards and can be added to any version of Pumpkin Patch.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Mining Guild Tie Expansion Pack
Description:
“Those TIEs have been modified. They’re not Imperial.”
   – Sabine Wren, Star Wars: Rebels

The original TIE/ln design has served as the basis for countless variations serving many purposes, even those outside of Imperial demands. Thanks to their close collaboration with the Empire, the Mining Guild has access to state-of-the-art Sienar Fleet Systems technology, including their own version of this iconic starfighter. The result is a unique take on the TIE design, ideally suited for the Mining Guild’s operations and unlocking new tactical opportunities for your Scum and Villainy squadrons.

Within the Mining Guild TIE Expansion Pack, you’ll find six ship cards — including four unique pilots, five upgrade cards, a maneuver dial, and all the tokens you need to experience this classic starfighter in a whole new way.
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Long Beach-Opoly
Description: Familiar real estate themed acquisition race that uses landmarks from Long Beach California (a suburb of Los Angeles) as properties.

Name: Head Hints: Star Wars
Description: Who is strongest with the Force? Imagine entering the universe of Star Wars in this intergalactic version of the Head Hints game and choose to play as Luke Skywalker, Yoda, Princess Leia, or Chewbacca. Players try to guess the mystery card that's placed in their Star Wars character mask so they can boost their Force strength and become Clue Commander to help others guess their cards. But be careful…Darth Vader tokens take Force points away! The spinner will land on one of 5 different ways to give clues including acting it out, breathing like Darth Vader, or even doing a Yoda impression. The first player to reach 4 Force points wins.

Name: Street Masters: Mr. Apple
Description:
KS Exclusive

Contains:
1 Miniature + Rival/Ally card

Name: Street Masters: Stretch Goals
Description:
Additional playable fighter for the Street Masters board game.

The full content listing can be found in the Street Masters, List of Contents thread under "Street Masters Stretch Goals" and "Street Masters: 2nd Printing changes" (Kickstarter 1 Stretch Goals).

- 2 New Stages (Out of Time, Rude Awakening) 2 decks of 20 cards, 1 double sided stage map, stage tokens
- 1 New Enemy Faction (The Nahualli) 1 deck of 21 cards, 1 boss mini (Tlazolteotl) and enemy tokens - Note that no minis were created for minions
- 3 New Fighters (Clint, Max, Tiger Azules) 3 decks of 25 cards, 3 minis
- 6 Dividers for the above decks
- 1 New Story (Pestilence) 9 cards
- 9 Ally/Rival miniatures (Chan Chan, Darrius, Hanzo, Isabella, Mary-Ann, Mr. Apple, Project X, Sera O'Quinn, Zane)
- Various extra tokens (Damage and Block tokens)
- Ally/Rival cards for some content not included in base game

Name: The Orchardist
Description:
The Orchardist is a simultaneous-action card drafting game designed to teach the basics of pest management and crop care in orcharding systems.

Players are dealt eight face-down pest cards, each of which may contain 0 to 4 pests of four different types. Players also receive a hand of four crop cards comprising resources and actions for successfully growing and harvesting a crop, or revealing eliminating the pest cards. Each round, players all draw one more card for their hand, choose one to play, and pass the rest of their hand to the next player. Players must decide between monitoring and managing their pests, applying fertiliser and other crop enhancers, or amassing the seasonal workers, pack houses and export licences needed to make the most profit.

The cards run out after eight rounds, when players take turns to tally their scores. Type of orchard they have and the resource cards they have collected determine their base profit level. This is increased by fertiliser, pollination etc, but decreased by the particular pests that remain in their orchard. The game can be customised for regional orchard types.

Integrated Pest Management is part of an educational kit used in schools to teach children about horticulture and biology.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hungry Shark
Description:
It’s lunch time and panic spreads through the ocean. Sharks prey on every single fish that swims the sea and only the octopus cop can stop them. All through this frenzy you will have to be fast enough to escape before ending up in a hungry shark’s belly.

Hungry Shark is a family game for ages +6 with an average game time of 10 minutes. This mad and fun game has three different game styles: “childfish”, “gluttonous shark” and “sea bubbles.”

In this game of visual speed you have to count the number of fish that are saved from the hungry shark. Three decks of cards are placed, first the central card is flipped, and then the two cards of the side decks. You have to consider the position of the fish, the eagle shark and the police octopus. The one who guesses the correct answer will get the 3 cards. The one who at the end of the game has taken more cards will win.


"A la hora del almuerzo el pánico llega al fondo del océano. Los tiburones persiguen a todo pez que se mueva para darse un buen atracón y solo el pulpo policía puede pararles. Entre tanto
descontrol, deberás ser el más rápido en contar los peces que logran escapar de acabar en la panza de estos tiburones hambrientos."

Hungry shark es un juego de velocidad para toda la familia a partir de 6 años, de 2 a 6 jugadores compuesto por
54 cartas y una duración media de 10 minutos. Este alocado y divertido juego ofrece 3 modalidades de juego con nivel creciente de dificultad: Pezqueñines, Tiburón comilón y Burbujas marinas.

En este juego de velocidad visual hay que contar el número de peces que se salvan del hambriento tiburón. Se colocan tres mazos de cartas, primero se voltea la carta central, y posteriormente las dos cartas de los mazos laterales. Se tiene que considerar la posición de los peces, el tiburón comilón y el pulpo policía. El que acierte la respuesta correcta conseguirá las 3 cartas. Ganará aquel que al final del juego se haya llevado más cartas.

Name: Solomon Kane: The Right Hand of Doom
Description:
"Here's to Simeon's soul, God ha' mercy on the wretch and may he fail in the vengeance he swore to take on you"

- Solomon Kane, The Right Hand of Doom

Based on R.E Howard's story with the same name, The Right Hand of Doom is a story about a necromancer, and what happens when you cross him (spoiler – it’s not good). Luckily for Solomon, he arrives after the instigating event, so he is not the target of the necromancer’s wrath. Instead, he gets to try to halt this unholy vengeance. Whether he does or not is up to you.

"Blood gushes over the rusty steal bars and Simeon quickly gathers up the several appendage with his left hand and throws it into the night, through the window bars. For a moment, the necromancer stands by the window, muttering dark, arcane words."

Contents

    1 Storybook (1 Act/ 10 Chapters)
    1 Right Hand of Doom miniature
    48 Discovery Cards


This is an expansion, and cannot be played without the base game.

Name: Solomon Kane: Castle of the Devil
Description:
1 new adventure touching on dark alchemy in old Germany
2 Acts - 20 Chapters
3 Miniatures
4 new Tiles
60 Chapter cards
100 Discovery cards
Story book

Name: Solomon Kane: America – The New World
Description:
2 new adventures in the wild lands of America
5 Acts - 50 Chapters
16 Miniatures
12 new Tiles
150 Chapter cards
200 Discovery cards
Story Book

Name: Solomon Kane: Against the Vampires
Description:
2 new adventures in the Vampire's lair
5 Acts - 50 Chapters
27 Miniatures
12 new 20x20 cm map Tiles
150 Chapter cards
200 Discovery cards
Story Book

Name: Solomon Kane: Red Shadows
Description:
Hunt down the evil Le Loup in an epic, continent-spanning campaign
5 Acts - 50 Chapters
23 Miniatures
15 new Tiles
150 Chapter cards
200 Discovery cards
Story Book

Name: Solomon Kane: Heart of Africa
Description:
"The red pulsing Thing was lurking toward Kane like a thick cloud of blood in the air, that continually changed its shape and form..."
- R.E. Howard, Wings in the Night

In Solomon Kane’s time, Africa was a deeply mysterious and dangerous land. Little explored by Europeans, it was a place of near-legend. Kane is one of the few who dares to brave the trek to its shores, and fewer still who venture into its interior. For this reason, he is a stranger in this endless land of magic and cannibals, and has to rely more than ever on his inner strength and the blessings of his immortal companions. Unsurprisingly, it is not long before Solomon Kane is in the middle of a deadly situation once more.

This expansion adds 2 new adventures in the dark continent! These are the Wings in the Night and The Footfalls Within. Between them, these Adventures have a total of 5 Acts (50 chapters).

Wings in the Night: As soon as Solomon escapes from some dangerous cannibals, he falls straight into the fire from the frying pan, walking into a ruined village that has been terrorised by the inhuman akaana. These strange flying creatures seem to be a horrible amalgam of bat or bird and human, and they strain Kane’s definition of “God’s creatures” to breaking point. Solomon undertakes to protect the innocent villagers, and when this plan goes tragically wrong he swears vengeance as atonement for his error. Are they part of the strange natural world in this alien land, the work of the devil, or some dark summoning from the mind of a sick wizard? Any of these seem possible. And any of them are, depending on the path you take and decisions you make. Remember: You and your friends make the decisions in your games, and perhaps your skill or your luck outstrips his previous efforts! Fighting a numerous foe, who can fly as well as fight, makes this a unique challenge for the Puritan hero.

Footfalls Within: Solomon Kane does not approve of slavery. In fact, it utterly disgusts him, and his first thought, on finding a train of Arab slavery is: “Sons of iniquity, the wrath of God is upon ye.”  
 “The fury Solomon Kane felt would have been enough at any time and in any place to shake a man to his foundation; now it assumed monstrous proportions, so that Kane shivered as if with a chill, iron claws scratched at his brain and he saw the slaves and the slavers through a crimson mist.” So, despite the fact that he is alone, he cannot help himself. He must confront the slavers…

Contents:

    8 double-sided tiles
    14 Fight cards
    8 Fight Effect cards
    191 Discovery cards
     29 Miniatures
    2 Storybooks (5 Acts/ 50 Chapters)


This is an expansion, and cannot be played without the base game.

Name: Happy Heist
Description:
Happy Heist is a ridiculous card game about robbing banks! Gather 3-10 friends and battle to create bulletproof master-plans to break into the bank, bypass security and steal the cash.

One player is nominated to be The Bank, all the other players are Robbers. Robbers are dealt a hand of random items, weapons and skills (Action Cards) to use against the bank security systems (Security Cards) which The Bank is dealt a hand of, and can use in whatever order they wish. The Bank also takes one card describing a uniquely fortified or defended bank vault (Vault Card) for the final round.

One Security Round at a time, Robbers will play an Action Card and explain/role-play/justify how they would use it to defeat the Security Card. Creativity is key. The winner of each round is decided by The Bank and they will receive a new Action Card. When The Bank runs out of Security Cards, it's time for the Vault Round and Robbers can combine any of their remaining Action Cards to create an elaborate plan to break into the unique vault, get the cash, and escape.

Players will need to play their cards strategically, holding powerful cards for the final round if possible, and creatively justifying their choices to win over The Bank.

—description from the designer

Name: MMA Throwdown
Description:
MMA THROWDOWN is a fast-paced, simultaneous-turn role playing game that simulates the strategy, excitement, and unpredictability of a mixed martial arts contest in real time!

The object of the game is to outwit opponents by maximizing your strengths and exploiting their weaknesses in order to defeat them by either knockout, submission, referee stoppage (TKO), or judge’s decision. But in this sport, victory is never quite certain and even the most dire of situations can be salvaged in the final seconds.

Use your skills of deduction to out-think your opponent time and time again. But don't leave yourself open to that counter, because all it takes is one mistake to swing momentum the other way and leave you reeling in Survival Mode.

Remarkably simple to play and incredibly hard to master, MMA THROWDOWN is the only mixed-martial arts game of its kind.

Name: Mythic Wars: Nemesis
Description:
Mythic Wars: Nemesis is the second expansion set for Mythic Wars, which introduces two brand new types of cards, Battlegrounds & Interventions.

Mythic Wars: Nemesis contains


    5 Battlegrounds - which add extra bonuses and options to your battles
    11 Interventions - which can help your gods and goddesses to snatch victory from the jaws of defeat


Requires Mythic Wars: Clash of the Gods.

Name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy Rules Set
Description:
Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy is a tabletop game of devastating combat between awe-inspiring machines, set during the civil war that tore the galaxy apart. 2 players take control of a variety of Titans – colossal, bipedal war engines covered in thick armour and weapons which can level a city in a single salvo. It is a strategic challenge in which you pit your skill and cunning against your opponent in a battle to the death; a test of tactical skill demanding the management of the resources at your disposal, determining the optimal reactions to the evolving state of the battlefield.

The Rules Set includes a 96-page hardback book containing all the rules needed to play games of Adeptus Titanicus, from basic movement and resolving attacks through to advanced and optional rules which add incredible depth and tactical complexity. Along with the comprehensive rules manual, a host of accessories are included – Command Terminals, Battlefield Assets and more.

There is included a host of gaming accessories necessary for playing Adeptus Titanicus:

- 6 Titan Command Terminals: 2 Warlord Titan, 2 Reaver Titan, and 2 Warhound Titan Command Terminals, large card surfaces used to track the status of your Titans during games;
- 2 Questoris Knight Command Terminals, used to track the status of your Knight Banners during games;
- 28 Titan Weapon cards : these double-sided cards are placed on the Titan Command Terminals in-game to keep track of the weaponry you’ve deployed, with one side showing the weapon characteristics, and the reverse showing that it is disabled;
- 24 Mission and Stratagem cards: these detail the 6 Missions and 18 Stratagems from the rulebook in a handy small format;
- Battlefield Assets and Status Markers: Battlefield Assets are a frame of 6 plastic miniatures, used to represent certain Stratagems – this set includes 1 Macro Cannon Battery, 1 Apocalypse Missile Strongpoint, 1 Command Bastion, 1 Plasma Generator, 1 Communications Relay and 1 Void Shield Relay. Also included are markers for initiative, a wrecked Titan head which can be used as an objective marker, 50 status markers for use with Command Terminals, 6 designation markers for the Titans on the battlefield and 3 arc templates used to determine weapon firing arcs;
- 2 reference sheets, quickly detailing the Phases of the game along with at a glance information on Orders, Repair Actions, Hit Roll Modifiers, Armour Roll Modifers, rules for Smash Attacks, Reactor Overload table, Awakened Machine Spirit table, Catastrophic Damage table, Damage Effects, Critical Damage Effects, and Common Weapon Traits;
- 21 Adeptus Titanicus dice: 1 D6 Reactor Die, 1 D6 Hit Location Die, 2 Numbered D10, 6 D6 Order Dice, 10 Adeptus Titanicus D6, and1 Scatter die;
- 2 clear blast markers and a flame template, representing explosions and fiery bursts in-game.
Families: Game: Adeptus Titanicus – The Horus Heresy (Games Workshop)

Name: Rise to Nobility: Beyond
Description:
In Rise to Nobility: Beyond you will collect and guard precious Relics, give offerings to the Timeless Temple, and help the kingdom’s Elders so they can grant you favors or permanently win their endorsement in your path to become a Noble citizen of the Five Realms.

During that time you will have access to the Realms precious mineral, the Rock Rose, which will present you the opportunity to trade it for Goods, Coins, earn you the Queen’s reputation and more, but like anything else that is precious, it comes in limited quantities so be careful how you spend it.

Rise to Nobility: Beyond introduces new ways to score points, a twist to the reputation mechanic and tableau building aspect that adds high replayability to the game.

Name: Singin' in the Game!
Description:
This goal of the game is to allow people to discover and sing every title from every famous artist.

Hand 1: Find from 1 to 6 titles or songs from an artist.
Hand 2: Find the name of an artist using the clue-titles (and sing them).
Hand 3: Find more titles of an artist than the other players.

—description from the designer

Name: Call to Adventure: The Name of the Wind
Description:
Call to Adventure: Name of the Wind is a 75-card expansion for Call to Adventure based on The Kingkiller Chronicle by Patrick Rothfuss. This expansion, and others to follow, add new challenges, new destinies, and mechanisms unique to the author's world to the base game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Highway to Hell
Description:
Welcome to 2054. Climatic and economic crises have destabilized our societies.
States are no more than the shadow of themselves and the world is slowly turning to chaos. Violence has increased to epidemic proportions in every city, while in the wastelands between them, militias have been formed to stem the tide gang warfare that has brings terror to the roads.
Following the collapse of government, catastrophic shortages in fuel and food have seen these consumables become commodities to fight and die for. In this post apocalyptic nightmare, the Patrollers
have become taken up the role of the sheriffs of the Old West, as they struggle to maintain order amid the all-encompassing chaos.
You are one of the Patrollers tasked with preserving law and order in District 31 of Corkland. Today your 24 hour patrol will take you through Conway, Green Lea and Altamont counties. This region to the south of Corkland has been claimed by the Jezebel Queens, a dangerous and violent gang who have been plundering the area for weeks now.
It’s time to restore some order!

Each player takes on the role of a Patroller, a highway sheriff who pits themselves against the many threats that infest District 31 while helping and protecting its surviving residents.
During their patrol, a Patroller will journey through three Sector.
As they pass through these Sectors, they will be able to replenish their hand of Action cards, customize their Vehicle and pick up Passengers who may suggest additional missions.
During their travels, a Patroller must resolve various Pursuits, Shootouts or Enforcements.
A Patroller must finish their patrol in the least amount of time and with the most Pacification Points.
If a Patroller’s patrol takes longer to complete than the number of Hours allocated to it, they will be subject to penalties at the end of the game.
At the end of the game, the Patroller with the most Pacification Points wins the game.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Games with expansions that add solo play

Name: Quintangled:  A Game of Strategy, Chance, and Destiny
Description:
Enter the magical, mythical, and sometimes perilous realm of Quintangled, a visually delightful board game of strategy, chance and the mysterious element of destiny. You will embark on a heroic quest where you'll meet oracles of wisdom, helpers and hinderers, encounter perils and pitfalls and battle forces that could destroy them.

Each player must enter The Abyss and also perform Heroic Feats as you prepare to journey home. Success is largely a function of strategy, opportunities presented by rolls of the die, and the elements of Fate and Magical Aid as you and your fellow players vie to win the game. Quintangled is not a game of war or world domination where conquest wins but a fun experience that is a metaphor for the universal journey of life that transcends time and culture. The game's unique two-part structure challenges players to see how choice changes everything and motives can make all the difference.

Every game experience will be different as you navigate many opportunities and encounter twists of Fate that will create a different outcome each time you play. The adventure of Quintangled is the adventure of life!

—description from the publisher

Name: Exploding Horcruxes
Description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION

    
    
         The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Exploding Horcruxes is a non-authorized version of Exploding Kittens.

    


Exploding Horcruxes is a fast paced, Russian roulette style game where if you happen to draw the Horcrux you die and are out of the game. Every other card in the deck helps you avoid this fate with things like diving the future, skipping, and attacking the other witches and wizards playing with you.

It is full of wizarding world references and jokes that the nerd in you will love.

—description from the publisher

Name: Builders!: The Building-Building Deck Building Game
Description:
Builders! is a deck-builder in which you're trying to build the tallest, and most valuable, skyscrapers in the city. During your turn you will uses the cards in your hand, Employees, to buy more cards from the market. They could be additional Employees, to make your deck better, for Floors that you can build in your plaza.

Employees are the cards that make up your deck, giving you the resources that you need to either your your own Floors, or to tear the Floors that other people have down. Some specialize at building certain types of buildings, others help you hire more people to your deck, and still more have other special abilities.

As soon as you build a Floor, you've got a Building. Multiple Floors can be stacked to build a higher Building, getting you more points in the process. Doing so puts you at risk of jealous competitors tearing your stuff down, or an unfortunate visit from the Building Inspector.

The game ends based upon the number of Floors in play (8 for 4 players, 9 for 3 player, 10 for 2 players). At that point players determine their end score by adding the value of each Floor they have built, the height of each Floor, and any additional Value they may have added through other Floors creating buffs or advantages. The player with the highest cumulative value wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tiddlywinks Golf Game
Description:
This is a golf simulation game where one flips their ball (a tiddlywink counter) towards the hole. For each hole, the players construct a fairway of par 3-5, with or without sand traps or water hazards. A player's score at the end of any hole is equal to how many times they needed to flip their ball (counter) plus any penalties they received. Whoever has the lowest score at the end of either 9 or 18 holes, wins.

—user summary

Name: Es geht um die Wurst
Description:
The players start on the colored spaces. As long as they are on the square spaces, movement is determined by a black-white die.
Movement is one space (black or white). If a pawn gets on an occupied space, the first pawn is thrown out and has to begin anew.

On the circular spaces, movement is determined by a number die. If a pawn gets on an occupied space while moving forward, the first meeple is pawn out and has to begin anew. If a player rolls more than he needs to reach the sausage pot, he has to use the surplus points to move backwards. If he gets on an occupied space, he has to move further backwards, depending on his rolled number.

The first player to reach the sausage pot wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Posthuman Saga: Resistance Expansion
Description:
Posthuman Saga: Resistance Expansion continues the overarching story presented in the Base Game taking you deeper into the Wilds to track down Mutant Slave Trains carrying human captives and following them to a Mutant Stronghold.

Posthuman Saga: Resistance Expansion adds several new mechanics to the Posthuman Saga Base game along with new ways of scoring and winning the game. Resistance also adds a lot of new content, including 2 new Characters, new Followers, new Mission Objectives, new Event cards and the new Veteran Mutant die as well as a new deck of Level 3 Encounters including over 30 stories.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fast Flags
Description:
Get rid of your cards first by putting down cards where two or more Flags match the Flags on the card on the table!

—description from the publisher

Name: Zombicide: Invader – Plague Gang Survivor Pack
Description:
Kickstarter Exclusive set of 5 original Survivors designed by the talented Stefan Kopinski, including their figures and ID cards.

This team, specialized in dealing with emergency situations in infected environments, is well suited to dealing with the crisis at PK-L7. They are smart and flexible, free from normal military protocols. All members of the Plague Gang are so resourceful they are able to perform Search actions in any Zone, not only rooms.

—description from the publisher

Name: Zombicide: Invader – Orphans Gang Survivor Pack
Description:
Kickstarter Exclusive set of 6 original Survivors designed by the great Karl Kopinski and sculpted by Patrick Masson, including their figures and ID cards.

Ever since the St Stilton orphanage was burned down during a riot, there has been an Orphans Gang formed by the abandoned survivors of that incident. The gang roams the galaxy, staying out of the way of the authorities and carving out a living by scrounging, scamming, or whatever else works. The Orphans Gang is always ready to welcome new members, as it's also used to losing members to tragedies such as prison, death, or becoming an adult. Perhaps in a remote mining outpost they can lay low quietly for a while.

All members of the Orphans Gang share the same trait, common to street urchins: it's impossible to hold them down. As such they all have the Unstoppable skill as a bonus, allowing them to slip by mobs of Xenos (or burst through them, in the case of Goliath).

—description from the publisher

Name: Zombicide: Invader – Kabuki Gang Survivor Pack
Description:
Kickstarter Exclusive set of 6 original Survivors designed by Adrian Smith, including their figures and ID cards.

The Kabuki Gang is an actual performance troupe that was touring the base when the Xenos attacked. The members of this troupe, most of them with rather shady pasts, didn't hesitate to pick up arms and face the invaders. Assuming the identity of the characters they were playing in their performance of Yotsuya Kaidan (including traditional wardrobe and masks), these actors scrambled to find whatever they could to help them in their fight. This means this group of Survivors each starts the game with an extra Equipment card, randomly drawn from the pile. The show, as they say, must go on!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Hunters A.D. 2114: New Huntsville
Description:
A small and seemingly sleepy mining town called New Huntsville is full of dangers awaiting any survivor brave enough to walk its streets.
—description from the publisher

New Huntsville, a first expansion for The Hunters A.D. 2114, is a new location with its own story.

Name: Länder der Welt
Description: On the world tour that awaits in Länder der Welt, players need to identify different countries by their flag, the capital, or their geographic location. Players can call for help from hints and joker cards, but the fewer hints a player needs, the faster they orbit the world!

Name: Posthuman Saga: The Outcast Promo Pack
Description:
The Outcast promo pack has 4 cards in it:

1x Mutated Follower (The Outcast)
1x Half-Moon Club
1x Crossbow
1x Outcast's Map

Name: Posthuman Saga: Wanderer Hero Pack
Description:
The Wanderer has a slightly stronger stat line but comes with a mutation. Having said that, his travels deep into the Mutant Lands have made him adapt to mutations more than other characters, and he can use them more to his advantage than most. This new Hero comes with his deck of unique development cards, deck of combat cards, unique items, tokens, miniature and character card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Storm Strike
Description:
Ancient skeletons and mouldering corpses crawl from their barrows, called forth by the dark sorcery of Nagash, Supreme Lord of the Undead. Ancient beyond reckoning, cruel and infinitely calculating, Nagash seeks to remake the Mortal Realms in his own image, transforming them into an ordered empire of mindless thralls, leashed to his will. In opposition, thunder rolls as the Stormcast Eternals, heavenly champions of order, rage forth to meet this threat head-on in epic clashes to decide the fate of the world, This is a new epoch, a time of mighty battles and unending war, a time of heroes and monsters. This is the Age of Sigmar!

Ideal for those new to Warhammer Age of Sigmar, and the wider hobby of collecting, building, painting and playing with Citadel miniatures, Storm Strike is a starter set containing 15 push-fit miniatures split across the factions of the heroic Stormcast Eternals and ghastly, undead Nighthaunt – mortal enemies locked in unending combat – along with detailed guides on assembling, painting and playing with them.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Domino: Im Einsatz
Description:
Alarm! Alarm! Blue lights are speeding around everywhere! Which vehicles and personnel belong to the police, to the emergency medical services, or to the fire department?

In Domino: Im Einsatz, you need to look closely and lay down the tiles appropriately. With some luck and a good eye, you can secure the most blue lights and win.

Name: Drachenschreck
Description:
Drachenburg Castle is besieged by dragons who keep snatching its residents and are unwilling to release them, so you and your fellow players have been called in to save the day.

By rolling the right colors in Drachenschreck, players succeed in scaring off the naughty dragons, which allows the castle residents to free themselves. But it's not an easy task because gray dice immediately fall into the well. The player who takes risks when rolling and earns the most stars by rescuing castle residents wins.

Name: Fridos Beute
Description:
Frido the Raccoon returns from a successful treasure hunt, but he has hidden his treasures so well that he is now unable to locate them. Are the players able to help him?

Fridos Beute is a test of memory because the more treasures the players find, the more gems they receive as a finder's reward. The first player to amass 13 gems wins.

Name: Spielesammlung
Description: In the ten different games in Meine ersten Spiele: Spielesammlung, children learn to group colors and shapes. Matching games train the memory, while dicing and stacking develop eye-hand coordination. Children can also indulge in free play with this game collection and immerse themselves in the colorful, happy world of the farm.

Name: Regenbogenrutsche
Description:
Kolya the Cat wants to slide down the rainbow, just like the cloud sheep.

In Meine ersten Spiele: Regenbogenrutsche, the children work together to build a colorful rainbow slide. They will learn the numbers from one to three and the six colors of the rainbow.

Name: Pokémon TCG: Luminous Frost Theme Deck
Description:
The Luminous Frost Theme Deck is from the Burning Shadows expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, but also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It  predominantly focuses on Water and Fire type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Alolan Ninetales.

Like other Theme Decks, Luminous Frost includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, an Alolan Ninetales deckbox and a TCGO deck access code. (User Summary.)

Name: Pokémon TCG: Rock Steady Theme Deck
Description:
The Rock Steady Theme Deck is from the Burning Shadows expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, but also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It  predominantly focuses on Fighting and Psychic type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Midday Form Lycanroc.

Like other Theme Decks, Rock Steady includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, a Lycanroc deckbox and a TCGO deck access code. (User summary.)

Name: Ogre Miniatures Second Edition
Description:
This is the newest edition of this ruleset, soon to be shipping after a successful Kickstarter campaign. It updates the rules for new units, as well as corrections from earlier rule editions.

It is a hardcover book, with several sheets of tokens and templates included.

Also includes a chapter on assembly, painting, and basing miniatures, as well as how to make scenery pieces.

Name: The Baseball Card Game
Description:
An impressive, minimalist approach to playing “dice baseball” (although this game uses a card-draw from a standard playing-card deck for its random-results generation). Designer Jeff Downey has managed to incorporate just about every nuance of table-top baseball into a few pages of very clear rules and only two charts. If you like to rush, this is potentially the quickest playing baseball game available.

Very general player-attributes are “graded” for overall skill (Batter, Eye, Power, Defense/Fielding, Speed) i.e. a batter’s Power rating could be “Star”, “Good”, “Average”, or “Poor”. Likewise, a pitcher would be rated similarly for Control etc.

For each at-bat, a card is drawn. It is first checked against the pitcher-rating chart, and depending on the result, following cards may need to be drawn, i.e. the pitcher-result may indicate “Batter”. In this case, the batter has put the ball into play and so the batter chart is used when drawing the next card (using the 
batter’s particular rating, of course.) The result might be a hit or possibly “Eye”, so then the batter’s ability to wait for a good pitch is being called into question. We go to “Eye” chart and draw another card for the result etc.

Steal, bunt, hit and run, double plays, sac flys, errors, and fielding are all represented in this fascinating, fast and very successful “micro-game”.

It is easiest to use a fictional team and randomly generate the attribute-grades, but you can certainly use real stats and create a general guide for using historical players.

—user summary

Name: Pokémon TCG: Leaf Charge Theme Deck
Description:
The Leaf Charge Theme Deck is from the Celestial Storm expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the seventh expansion in the Sun & Moon series. However, it also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It predominantly focuses on Grass and Lightning type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Sceptile.

Like other Theme Decks, Leaf Charge includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, a Sceptile deckbox and a TCGO deck access code. (User summary.)

Name: Yu-Gi-Oh! TCG: Starter Deck – Codebreaker
Description:
Starter Deck: Codebreaker introduces the basics of Dueling with cards that are strong and easy to understand. New Duelists can learn the basics of Link Summoning using “Code Talker” Link Monsters, then use this Starter Deck as a base to build their own unique Deck by collecting Cyberse monsters and “Code Talker” Link Monsters from many different releases including Structure Deck: Cyberse Link and Extreme Force. To ensure Duelists have the tools necessary to ramp up those basic techniques and take Link Summoning to the next level, Starter Deck: Codebreaker includes powerful additions like Linkuriboh, previously unreleased in Latin American and European territories!

Link Monsters are the newest addition to the Yu-Gi-Oh! TRADING CARD GAME! They offer Duelists a brand-new outlet to demonstrate their skills by mastering not just how they play their cards, but where they play them as well. These new monsters have become an integral part of Dueling, and Starter Deck: Codebreaker contains 5 Link Monsters to give new Duelists a leg up in competition.

Starter Deck: Codebreaker contains 45 cards:
2 Ultra Rares
3 Super Rares
40 Commons
1 Beginner’s Guide
1 Game Mat

—description from the publisher

Name: Asteroid Field
Description:
Asteroid Field is a chaotic solitaire card game in which you are the computer of the autonomous miner spaceship A-438 that works in the asteroid belt. Your mission is transport the mineral from the base asteroid to the artificial storage planetoid with the minimum cost.

The players form a board of 5 x 4 cards as the asteroid field. The game goal is to cross the asteroid field without being destroyed while using the smallest quantity of fuel. If the ship is destroyed or the fuel runs out, the player loses. The player can try to improve his marks crossing the field spending less fuel units.

The player uses a token as spaceship to cross the field, he can change the ship's speed and direction. In each turn, asteroids disposition in the field changes chaotically according the rules. There are cards to control speed and fuel consumption.

The only randomness in Asteroid Field is the card order. This game is chaotic because despite having all the data it will be hard to predict the result of the game.

-description from designer

Name: Lords of Maleryth
Description:
"The decline of the great Malerythian Empire began with the sudden and mysterious death of the Emperor. The eight houses of the nobility plummeted into a ruthless cold war in an effort to claim the throne. You control one of these houses and must use everyone at your disposal (including covert agents, military geniuses, scientists, traders, diplomats and administrators) to ensure that the next in line is allied with your house."

Lords of Maleryth is a fast-flowing deck management game set in an interstellar empire.  Using a  deck building mechanic, players must defend their own deck whilst attempting to remove cards from their opponents decks, control fleet movements on a central board, and develop rule-breaking technology.

The majority of cards represent different characters in the Empire with different skills and abilities. Each card is numbered sequentially.Once the central supply deck is depleted the game ends, and the player with the lowest numbered card in play in front of them wins.

Unique player communication rules add to the pressure, meaning that players indulging in thinking time give their opponents opportunity to scheme against them, whereas players who think fast limit their opponents opportunities.

—description from the publisher

Name: Drinks With Frenemies: Original Edition
Description:
The game of creating friends out of enemies & enemies out of friends. If you like games, drinking and sabotaging your friends, this game is for you! Drinks with Frenemies is a card game that brings the worst out of you and rewards you for it!

It's an entertaining party game that will keep you on your toes as you adjust to the ever-changing rules. It's a drinking game that's also family friendly. Meaning you can play with any type of beverage you prefer. In fact, we've made gameplay rules for those who wish not to drink at all. From water to moonshine, we think there's no perfect way to ruin... uh... enhance your relationships!

It's a great icebreaker game that gets you moving, thinking and laughing. We've designed it to be instantly playable and incredibly enjoyable with rules that are simple to follow and cards that are easy to understand. It's just as much fun to watch others play as it is to play the game yourself. It's a great addition to any game night, pre-game or party and makes for a great gift for birthdays, graduations and holidays!

—description from the publisher

Name: Drinks With Frenemies: NSFW Edition
Description:
The game of creating friends out of enemies & enemies out of friends. If you like games, drinking and sabotaging your friends, this game is for you! Drinks with Frenemies is a card game that brings the worst out of you and rewards you for it!

It's an entertaining party game that will keep you on your toes as you adjust to the ever-changing rules. It's a drinking game that's also family friendly. Meaning you can play with any type of beverage you prefer. In fact, we've made gameplay rules for those who wish not to drink at all. From water to moonshine, we think there's no perfect way to ruin... uh... enhance your relationships!

It's a great icebreaker game that gets you moving, thinking and laughing. We've designed it to be instantly playable and incredibly enjoyable with rules that are simple to follow and cards that are easy to understand. It's just as much fun to watch others play as it is to play the game yourself. It's a great addition to any game night, pre-game or party and makes for a great gift for birthdays, graduations and holidays!

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Adult Versions of Family-Friendly Games

Name: Drinks With Frenemies: Retro Edition
Description:
The game of creating friends out of enemies & enemies out of friends. If you like games, drinking and sabotaging your friends, this game is for you! Drinks with Frenemies is a card game that brings the worst out of you and rewards you for it!

It's an entertaining party game that will keep you on your toes as you adjust to the ever-changing rules. It's a drinking game that's also family friendly. Meaning you can play with any type of beverage you prefer. In fact, we've made gameplay rules for those who wish not to drink at all. From water to moonshine, we think there's no perfect way to ruin... uh... enhance your relationships!

It's a great icebreaker game that gets you moving, thinking and laughing. We've designed it to be instantly playable and incredibly enjoyable with rules that are simple to follow and cards that are easy to understand. It's just as much fun to watch others play as it is to play the game yourself. It's a great addition to any game night, pre-game or party and makes for a great gift for birthdays, graduations and holidays!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Wild Nature (fan expansion for Potion Explosion)
Description:
The Wild Nature (fan expansion for Potion Explosion; TWN) is an Unofficial Fan-made Print and Play expansion for the Potion Explosion Boardgame (it is not a project by Horrible Games, the publisher of Potion Explosion).

TWN introduces a new Ingredient - Wild Nature Essence (green marbles), a new board - Nature Leaf, 4 new Potions and 9 new Professors.

Wild Nature Essence - when activated in an Explosion - will trigger a Wild Explosion (between different colored marbles). This will enhance the Explosion possibilities and your brewing Potions abilities.

The new Potions, and the newly arrived Professors each with their unique view on brewing Potions, both add more variety to the game.

You can download the rules and components from the files and adding 12 green marbles (you must provide them) you have this new expansion ready!

-description from designer

Name: A Game of Thrones: Catan – Brotherhood of the Watch: 5-6 Player Extension
Description:
New heroes rise to face the danger beyond the Wall in A Game of Thrones: Catan – Brotherhood of the Watch – 5-6 Player Extension! The forests of the North conceal many secrets, and the Wildlings have only begun their attack on the Night's Watch. With new allies and enemies, will you be able to defend the Wall and win the title of Lord Commander?

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire

Name: Catan Scenario: Crop Trust
Description:
In Catan Scenario: Crop Trust, players balance their individual need to harvest crops against their collective goal to store and preserve seeds in the Seed Vault. Players who harvest too much endanger the seed diversity, and in doing so, threaten Catan with mass extinctions and a collapse of the food supply.

This scenario was developed in collaboration with the Global Crop Diversity Trust, an independent international organization whose goal is to preserve crop diversity in order to protect global food security.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Eternal Battle
Description:
The Eternal Battle –cooperative tactical boardgame with rpg elements (and with miniatures and terrain!) made for 1-4 players.

There are 5 story based campaigns made in fantasy settings. Players control heroes of the game: they are unique, have own background, and through the course of adventure they will get new abilities, find new treasures and follow non-linear story (it`s not just words). 4 campaigns following big epic story arc about heroism, loyalty, intrigues and war. Your choices during the campaigns will change not just your walkthrough but a final state of the civilized lands around you.

Stand-alone campaign Heroes for Hire more focused on small scale events and local characters, and concentrate on the border village under the threat of the bandit raid (Who would survive to the end of the campaign and who will fall under the marauder`s blades, while trying to protect the innocents? Weary but stalwart soldier? Old but smart herbalist? Bitter and fearless blacksmith? Former poacher with a brave heart?.. and many more – play the game and you`ll choose their fate).

            
        
    


All battles happen on the game tile (that divided into squares). Heroes and enemies represented by high quality miniatures. Enemies are controlled by the game act accordingly to their AI (written in the "Tactic" cards). Plastic 3D terrain will create different landscapes and make battles more interesting and tactically advanced. Sometimes players will use 10-sided dice, to determine success of their actions. Battle is turn-based and has strong cooperative elements. Between the fights the Eternal Battle gives a lot of roleplay possibilities for those who like this. (game designer joked about it as "D&D from the box")

                
            
        
    


There are two game modes: In "single mission" game mode players must fulfil mission objectives (kill all enemies, save NPC, check all quest places, kill Boss, survive number of rounds, etc.). In the "campaign mode", players must complete missions, move forward through non-linear story, and make decisions: what to do before next mission, and what next mission will be about. Until players reach one of the campaign goals.

—description from the publisher

Name: Game of Phones: Expansion 001 – Creative Pack
Description:
Get Creative!

Expansion Pack 001 is all about getting creative: taking photos, videos, and even drawing. There are 30 all new cards to go with the main game.

Game of Phones is a Battle of Smartphone Skills, perfect for those who can't escape their phones! The only requirement to play this game is the Game of Phones deck of cards and a smartphone. Take on challenges such as:

Finding the best selfies
Taking photos of other players
Showing your worst or funniest texts

Game of Phones makes a great gift for teens who can't look up from their smartphones for more than two minutes at a time, and parents who don't want to be left out of the fun.

-description from publisher

Name: Havok: Battle Cards
Description:
In Havok you play as a god. From your deck, you must select your champions wisely, armour them strategically and defeat other gods’ champions. When you defeat an opposing gods champion it becomes your servant and joins your deck. The winner if the first player to claim all opponents’ cards.

Players start with a few champions, upgrade them with powerful weapons and shields then send them into battle. Clever game mechanics can punish heavily armoured champions and chaos cards can level the odds on the turn of a card.

Havok is a fast-paced game that is extremely simple to pick up. You certainly won’t need a PHD in card games to get going. The creators have even included a simple multiplication guide to help younger players with any complicated sums!

One of its defining features is the beautiful artwork promised on each card.

—description from the designer

Name: Destiny Aurora: Renegades – Tactical Cards
Description:
Add special abilities to your commander - both on the planet surface and in space. Strategize and overcome your opponents with this new addition to the Destiny Aurora universe.

—description from the publisher

Name: Summer
Description:
Summer, a game of sand, water and castles, is a 18 cards microgame.

In Summer your goal is to build a sand castle by placing a card on other previously played cards and tokens. Each card shows four symbols of sand and water. When water and sand from different cards mix (one symbol covers the other) they build a little tower (represented by a token).

—description from the designer

Name: Battle Board Roller
Description:
A game played on a chessboard with battle-chits. The battle-chits have swords or shields on different edge's, they also have a dice symbol in the middle. the four royal battle-chits on each side have a crown. the game is themed on Medieval knights. You setup like chess in the top and bottom two rows arranged anyway you want.

In a turn if a sword contacts an enemy chit that has no shield opposing it the enemy chit is removed from the board. Each turn you roll a die, one of the battle-chits on either side can be rotated to maybe attack with sword or defend with shield. after you decide to rotate or not you may move a chit on your side one square in any direction.

The goal of the game is to capture at least two of the enemy crown battle-chits.

Name: TimeMaster the game
Description:
A Time Guardian hunting for the seven crystal shards to stop the dreadbots from taking them to control time.

The game is a solitaire or two player game, played on a large grid with interconnecting mechanisms to show local-time-travel and deep-time-travel. the Time-master moves on the board trying to land on the crystals or landing on the dreadbots to destroy them and take the crystals they carry. The dreadbots move around trying to kill the Time-master or collect crystals.

The object of the game is to collect all seven crystals before the dreadbots do.

Name: Kuzushi Seasons
Description:
Based on iconic seasonal flowers found in Japan, Kuzushi Seasons  pits 2, 3 or 4 players against each other in a unique game of positional influence and control. Simple rules lead to beautiful complexities in this abstract area control tile placement card game. It's smart, fun, approachable and addictive.

Card placement and area control is all resolved orthogonally to other cards. So up, down, left and right only. Players try to control more of the board through influence from the base cards they play on each turn. Then they check up, down, left and right of the base they place to see what player (if any) has a majority of base cards around it. If no one has more bases than anyone else around it, that square is uncontrolled, and any flag there is returned to its owner, which they can again either as a base or a flag as required.

This makes for a dynamic board that gets built out into a square as play continues (6x6 for 2 players, 7x7 for 3 players, or 8x8 for 4 players). Once the boundaries are established, play continues until all the board is filled. The winner is the player who has the most cards of their color on the board. If there's a tie, the player with the largest "island" of their color cards touching is the winner.

—description of the publisher

Name: A.E.G.I.S.: Combining Robot Strategy Game – Variant Command Expansion Set
Description:
During the Five Nations War's greatest battles, the robots of these new heroes and villains took on powerful new forms when the situation was dire!

Promo set of Variant Commander Robots for A.E.G.I.S. for use after the campaign mode, variants each have a combination of alternative attack abilities, modified states, or alternative commander powers.Each robot in the expansion uses an existing game piece.

These new robots can be included in commander draft, or in constructed play, and allow for new and different strategies.

This expansion was previously available as a part of the kickstarter campaign, but does not come included in the retail base set. In A.E.G.I.S' numbering system, this is "Expansion Set 6"

Name: Paparazzi: Gæt en kendt
Description:
Paparazzi is an entertaining team- and party-game for adults, where the goal is to guess famous persons. The persons to guess can be known from, tv & movies, sports, writing, royal life, fictive persons, historical persons, and many other.

Make two teams of at least 2 players each. Team A starts. Team A choose a player (Mr. X), to give clues, and the team have four rounds to guess the person on the card, the faster the more points.

The four rounds are: Give 2 out of 3 clues. Draw letters from a bag and spell out clues, mime or draw, and finally answer yes/no-questions from the team. The team that first reaches goal wins the game.

Lots of laughter, and enterainment for you and your co-players.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Paparazzi er et underholdende hold- og selskabsspil for voksne, hvor det gælder om at gætte kendte personer. Personerne, som skal gættes, er kendt fra bl.a. film og tv, sportens verden, er forfattere, royale personer, fiktive personer og historiske personer.

Der dannes to hold af minimum to, og hold A begynder. De udvælger en Mr. X til at give ledetråde, som så har fire runder til at få sine holdkammerater til at gætte personen på kortet - jo hurtigere desto flere point.

De fire runder går ud på at udvælge ledetråde, sammensætte bogstaver, mime eller tegne og til sidst at stille ja/nej-spørgsmål. Det hold, der først får deres brik i mål, vinder.

Der er lagt op til masser af grin, og underholdning for dig og dine medspillere.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dash Arena
Description:
Jetpack powered handball in Space!!

Dash Arena is a two-player game in which players lead team of athletes in fast and chaotic sport of the far future. You will roll dice and move your figures with goal of scoring 5 or more points before your opponent. You score points by scoring goals (3 points) or by tackling opposing disk holder (1 point).

At the beginning of your turn, you will roll 3 dice. One die at a time, you will use those dice to move your figures. Number on die determines how many spaces figure must move. Figures move in a straight line, except if something makes them change their direction. After moving all of your figures, your opponent will do the same and so on.

Dash Arena has rules for basic and advanced game. Advanced game rules are just an upgrade to basic game rules. We recommend that you play a few games with basic rules only.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fierce Fight! Typhoon Blitzkrieg
Description:
The game starts on September 30, 1941 and ends January 30, 1942, covering both the German drive on Moscow and the Soviet counterattack. It uses the chit-pull system from Struggle of Army Group Manstein/A Victory Lost and the map links with the Fierce Fight! Barbarossa series.

Counters: 252 1.3 cm/0.51inch
Unit Scale: Divisions
Hex scale: 10 miles / 16 km
Time Scale: 10 days per turn
Map: 72 x 51 cm
Map limits: From Moscow (east) to Smolensk (west), Kalinin (north) to Kursk (south).


Included in Game Journal issue #67

Name: Off The Grid
Description:
Off The Grid Board Game is a fun family game played without electricity—get out your flashlights!
     Use your creativity and interact with real people instead of computers and screens!
     Choose 5 activities from a deck of 42 cards for a fun time!


Off The Grid Board Game is designed to get kids "off the grid" and promotes creative and interactive play, employing a deck of activity cards that specify various fun children's games, including traditional playtime activities such as match-the-pairs, guess-the-drawing, and indoor bowling. Fun for family game night, and helps get kids introduced to board games in a way that they can really get into, with simple instructions they can read and follow.

Playtime for each sub-game is roughly 5 minutes, with full game time around 30 minutes. Most appropriate for kids ages 4-11, along with their older siblings/friends and parents/grandparents/caregivers.

—description from the publisher

Rules

     Shuffle the Off The Grid activity card deck.
     Randomly select 5 activity cards and place on the Off The Grid game board.
     Place the matching 5 station cards around your house where the activities will take place.
     Time to go “Off The Grid”! Turn off the lights and all electronics. 
     Play all 5 activities in sequence and declare the ultimate winner (i.e. the one who wins the most sub-games). Have fun!

Name: Glisse Glace
Description:
Under the watchful eye of their dads, the little penguins are having fun iceberg-hopping, but they must be careful not to fall into the water!

In Glisse Glace, players take turns flicking their puck into the playing area, then trying to push baby penguins from one puck to another. If they succeed, the player picks up baby tokens of the same color as the baby; if they fail (either by pushing dads or babies into the water), the player picks up dad tokens. When a pile of tokens is empty, the game ends, and players score positive points for their baby tokens — but only the player with the most points in each color counts — then deducts the dad tokens. Whoever has the most points wins!

Name: Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game: The Lord of the Rings – Battle of Pelennor Fields
Description:
As the sun begins to rise upon the fields of Pelennor, the great siege of Minas Tirith is all but lost… Yet hope has not faded and help is close at hand. Through the crisp morning air, the sound of horns can be heard ringing out, signalling the arrival of King Théoden and the Riders of Rohan. With the hosts of Mordor arrayed in their thousands, Théoden gives an impassioned speech and leads his men into the fray, riding for ruin and the world’s ending!

Prepare to enter the amazing world of Middle-earth, and recreate the greatest battles and adventures from The Lord of the Rings™ and The Hobbit™. In this box set, you’ll find all the miniatures (no less than 84!) and rules you and an opponent will need to defend the city of Minas Tirith – or take command of the forces of Evil and wage destruction and war upon the kingdom of Gondor. Included:

Miniatures

Good

- Théoden, King of Rohan on Foot and Horseback: this character is supplied as 2 models, 1 on foot and 1 mounted and charging. Both models feature options for a helmeted or unhelmeted head, and both are clad in heavy armour, and armed with his sword, Herugrim. On foot, Théoden holds a shield; mounted, that shield is stowed;

     12 Warriors of Rohan: foot-soldiers who make up the rank and file of the armies of Rohan. 4 models are armed with bows, 4 with hand weapons and shields, and 4 with spears and shields;
     12 Riders of Rohan: horse-masters beyond compare, renowned for their great skill and bravery. 4 are armed with spear and shield, 4 with bows, 2 with swords and shields, and 2 with axes and shields;
     20 Warriors of the Dead: restless spectral images of their former selves. 14 are armed with hand weapons, and 6 with spears.


Evil


     The Witch-King of Angmar on Fell Beast: the greatest of the Nazgûl, and Sauron’s most deadly lieutenant, the Witch-King of Angmar carries a sword, wears the Crown of Morgul and attacks with the Fell Beast’s teeth and claws;
     A Mordor Troll: spearheading attacks and breaking down fortress walls, this enormous creature wears heavy armour and is armed with a hand-and-a-half hammer;
     36 Morannon Orcs: hailing from the Black Gate these are a stronger breed of Orc than those who man Sauron’s other bastions. They wear brutal-looking, thick armour – 18 carry hand weapons and shields, and 18 carry spears and shields.


Rules

This box contains the complete, unabridged 208-page hardback Middle-earth Strategy Battle Game Rules Manual, packed with essential rules, guides and information covering Open, Narrative and Matched Play with your Middle-earth miniatures. Everything from the basic fundamentals of movement and combat through to fielding siege engines and casting magical powers is here, in an easy to follow format with annotated diagrams and photographs demonstrating the flow of battle. It even features beautifully-painted example armies, providing inspiration for your own collections.

As well as this, there’s a 16-page booklet – this contains the scenarios and profiles you’ll use in conjunction with the Rules Manual to recreate the Battle of Pelennor Fields with the miniatures in this box. 4 Scenarios are included to play through – Charge of the Rohirrim, Théoden’s Last Stand, The March of the Dead and The Battle of Pelennor Fields – each of these in turn adds more and more miniatures from the box, increasing the scale of the battles as you play.

Accessories

A selection of gaming accessories are included, necessary for play:


     12 6-sided dice;
     A 12" Rohan range ruler;
     A 12" Mordor range ruler;
     A double-sided sheet of punch-out tokens, used in game to denote effects and statuses of models. 


—description from the publisher
Families: Fictional Events: Battle of the Pelennor Fields

Name: Chicago
Description:
You are the boss of a mob family in old Chicago, trying to control the majority of business, pressing their owners for money and avoiding the FBI agents.

Chicago is a hand management game with an area control component, but in order to assure the control ob an ares (a.k.a. business) you have to fulfil some requests (every business has his own requestes) and suffer a consequence (usually loss of some cards).

Chicago is the first game in the Small Box category from MS Jogos.

—description from the publisher

Name: Milibarries Series 1
Description:
This is a collectible figurine strategy board game. The goal of the game is to defeat your opponent's troops, or "Barries", with your own Barries. Each Barry has Health, Damage, and Range, along with other distinguishing features.

To play, place 6 Barries on your side of the battlefield, and put number tiles under each Barry. Then, roll the die to see which Barry attacks, number tile corresponding with number rolled. When a Barry takes damage, mark it using the damage sheet (sheet shown in documents), and then your opponent rolls. Repeat until all Barries are gone from one side of the battlefield.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dogfight squadron cards
Description:
The game simulates WWI or WWII dogfights with squadrons of fighters and bombers. it has a campaign game to fight a war. the game uses an ordinary deck of playing cards.

Gameplay has one squadron facing out against the other. you draw two cards per plane, these are your manoeuvre cards the four suits representing climb, dive, roll left and right. The cards are chosen but not shown to the enemy player. Each plane can be tailed or tailing or even unopposed. Having an unopposed plane is a big advantage because it can help join in a battle between other planes. each player shows one card if the direction is different then the plane breaks the tail and is tailing the enemy, but if the card is the same then a second card is flipped, if the direction is the same the tailing plane gets a shot, its a simple high low cut, but some cards add effects like ace's a new plane joins your dogfight.

The object of the game is air superiority but the campaign game adds ground targets.

—designer from the publisher
